member.summary: Current project item selected by the user. This can be null in cases where code generation is invoked from project root node.

member.summary: ServiceProvider for getting all code generation services and global visual studio services.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGenerator.Dependencies

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGenerator.GenerateCode
member.summary: Performs code generation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGenerator.TemplateFolders
member.summary: List of search paths of this code generator where templates/static files are searched for. By default, this list contains only one folder which is a sub-directory named "Templates\ inside the directory containing the CodeGenerator assembly. Custom code generators can override the default behavior.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGenerator.AddClassMemberFromTemplate(EnvDTE.Project,EnvDTE.CodeType,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.String)
member.summary: Adds the result of running a visual studio T4 text template to an existing source file as a class member at the end.
member.param: Project that contains the class. This is required for identifying the file extension with which the T4 template is searched for.
The class to which the code should be added.
Name of the template file. The actual text template file searched for is of the format "{templateName}.{codeLanguageFileExtension}.t4".
Parameters for the template. These parameters can be accessed in text template using a parameter directive. The values passed in must be either serializable or extend type.
Name of the member to be generated by the template. If a member with that name already exists in the class, nothing is done.
member.returns: True if the member was added. False otherwise (e.g. the member already existed).

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGenerator.AddFileFromTemplate(EnvDTE.Project,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes a template and adds the generated code as a project file.
member.param: Project in which file should be added.
The path of the file to be added relative to current project. This should not include the file extension. The file extension is inferred from running the text template.
Name of the template file. The actual text template file searched for is of the format "{templateName}.{codeLanguageFileExtension}.t4".
Parameters for the template. These parameters can be accessed in text template using a parameter directive. The values passed in must be either serializable or extend type.
If true and the file exists, then no action is taken. If false and the file exists, then the file will be overwritten.
member.returns: True if the file was added. False otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGenerator.AddFolder(EnvDTE.Project,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new folder to the active project at the given relative path. If a project item already exists for the active project at the given projectRelativePath, nothing is done. If there is already a folder on the disk but that is not part of the project, the folder is added to the project.
member.param: Project in which folder should be added.
This should be relative path of the the folder to be added.
member.returns: ProjectItem added.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGenerator.AddFile(EnvDTE.Project,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new file to the active project at the given relative path.
member.param: Project in which file should be added.
This should be relative path of the the file to be added.
Name of the source file including extension. If an absolute path is provided and the file exists, that file is used. Otherwise the source file is searched in the .
If true and file exists, then no action is taken. If false and file exists, then file is overwritten.
member.returns: True if the file was added. False otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGeneratorActionsService.AddFileToProjectHelper(EnvDTE.Project,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a file containing the given text to the active project at the given relative path. If there is a file on disk, it is overwritten. If the file already exists in the project, call OverwriteProjectItemTextContent instead.
member.param: Project in which file should be added.
This should be relative path including file extension of the file to be added.
Content of the file to be added.

member.summary: A default implementation of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeGeneratorFilesLocator.GetTextTemplatePath(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Finds a T4 Text Template of the format "{templateName}.{templateFileExtension}.t4" within the provided search folders.
member.param: Name of the template file without the extension.
Folders to search the file.
The extension for template file. This is usually code language based file extension like "cs" or "vb".
member.remarks: The actual file name searched for contains a .t4 string at the end, For example, if the templateName is "Default", when templateFileExtension is null or empty, the file name searched for is "Default.t4" and when templateFileExtension is "cs" or ".cs", the file name searched for is "Default.cs.t4".
member.returns: Full path of the T4 Text Template found first in the search folders.

member.summary: Finds a static file matching the given within the provided search folders.
member.param: Name of the file including the extension.
Folders to search the file.
member.returns: Full path of the static file found first in the search folders.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeService.GetCodeTypesFromLocalCodeElements(EnvDTE.CodeElements)
member.summary: Recursively scan to extract all CodeType elements. We're only interested in types defined in the project itself, so we disregard elements that contain one or more type with InfoLocation != vsCMInfoLocation.vsCMInfoLocationProject. However unfortunately for code namespaces, the InfoLocation is external for all the namespaces including the ones in the project, so we have to use a workaround.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeExtensions
member.summary: Useful extension methods for

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeExtensions.IsDerivedType(EnvDTE.CodeType,System.Type)
member.summary: Returns true if given is a matching type or a base type or an interface implemented by the .NET type represented by . This does not account for language-specific type representations, so will not be accurate for types with language-specific short names, such as primitive types or List(Of Integer).

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeExtensions.IsDerivedType(EnvDTE.CodeType,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if given is a matching type name or one of the base type names in the hierarchy of the .NET type represented by . This does not account for language-specific type representations, so will not be accurate for types with language-specific short names, such as List(Of Integer).
member.param: Code type which needs to be determined if it's a derived type.

The fullTypeName provided must be language representation of the type but not the Type.FullName from reflection. For example, the fullTypeName passed in VB must be "System.Data.Entity.DbSet(Of MyNamespace.MyModel)" but not System.Data.Entity.DbSet`1[MyNamespace.MyModel].

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeExtensions.AddMemberFromSourceCode(EnvDTE.CodeType,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a member to an existing or , at the end of the class, with text formatting options.
member.param: The class or interface to which the member should be added.
The source code of the member to be added. This must be valid code in the target project's language.
member.exception: is not an instance of either or .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeExtensions.AddMemberFromSourceCode(EnvDTE.CodeType,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a member to an existing or , with text formatting options.
member.param: The class or interface to which the member should be added.
The source code of the member to be added. This must be valid code in the target project's language.

The position in the class where the source code should be added. See documentation for EnvDTE.CodeModel.AddVariable for allowed values. If the value is null, the new member will be added to the end of the class.
member.exception: is not an instance of either or .

member.summary: Adds a member to an existing or .
member.param: The class or interface to which the member should be added.
The source code of the member to be added. This must be valid code in the target project's language.

The position in the class where the source code should be added. See documentation for EnvDTE.CodeModel.AddVariable for allowed values. If the value is null, the new member will be added to the end of the class.
Text formatting options.
member.exception: is not an instance of either or .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeExtensions.GetPublicMembers(EnvDTE.CodeType)
member.summary: Gets all public members for a given element.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeRefExtensions
member.summary: Useful extension methods for

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeRefExtensions.IsPrimitiveType(EnvDTE.CodeTypeRef)
member.summary: Returns true if the given CodeTypeRef represents a primitive .NET type, e.g., byte, bool, float, etc, otherwise false. Handles nullable primitive types as well.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeRefExtensions.IsMatchForReflectionType(EnvDTE.CodeTypeRef,System.Type)
member.summary: Returns true if the given CodeTypeRef matches the specified .NET type, false otherwise. If the represents a nullable type and the passed in is corresponding underlying type (ex: codeTypeRef is int? and type is int), that's considered a match. Passing in nullable .NET type for is not expected to work. This requires that is attached to a parent code element otherwise an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeRefExtensions.IsMatchingTypeName(System.String,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the given type name represents the given .NET type within the context of the given language (only C# and VB are supported). For example, List(Of System.Int32) and List(Of Integer) in VB both represent the .NET type List``1[System.Int32]

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeRefExtensions.GetShortTypeName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converts type names containing long primitive names, e.g., List(Of System.Int32), to language-specific short ones, e.g., List(Of Integer)

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.CodeTypeRefExtensions.ExtractNullableTypeParameterName(EnvDTE.CodeTypeRef)
member.summary:
If the given codeTypeRef represents a nullable type in either C# or VB, this method returns a string representation of the underlying type - a language-specific representation with full primitive names (e.g., MyStruct(Of System.Int32)) If the given codeTypeRef does not represent a nullable type in these languages, this method returns null.
The VB CodeModel API doesn't keep the type information when constructing CodeTypeRefs, Ex: CodeModel.CreateCodeTypeRef("MyStruct(Of System.Int32)") returns a codeTypeRef with AsFullName = "MyStruct(Of T)" - i.e., it loses generic type parameter information. So this method returns just the string represenation.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.RollbackService
member.summary: This class provides rollback support for code generators. It has some built in rollback functionality (eg: NewFileAdded), and the ability for code generators to provide any action via the AddRollbackAction method. These actions will be performed upon a code generation execution being rolled back. For internal microsoft use only. Use in custom code generators.

Relative path of the item that was added.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.IServiceRegistrar
member.summary: This interface provides a mechanism for code generators to register services in advance of code generation operations. Classes that implemenent this interface should export themselves as typeof(IServiceRegistrar) using .

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.IServiceRegistrar.RegisterServices(System.ComponentModel.Design.IServiceContainer)
member.summary: Provides a way to register services with the given IServiceContainer. The services added here can be used later by code generation operations through the IServiceProvider.
member.param: The container where services can be registered for use during code generation operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.SCodeGeneratorDialog
member.summary: Code generator dialog service in visual studio.
member.remarks:
This marker service interface can be used to obtain global services related to ASP.NET Scaffolding.
Interfaces that can be obtained from this service are:
to invoke Add -> New Scaffolded Item dialog from other VSPackage functionalities like custom visual studio menu implementation.
to register localized names for custom category node names defined by other VSPackages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.ServiceRegistrar
member.summary: This class is meant for scaffolding infrastructure use only and should not be called directly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.Templating.ITemplateInvoker
member.summary: Services for invoking T4 text templates for code generation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.Templating.ITemplateInvoker.InvokeTemplate(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Invokes a T4 text template and returns the result.
member.param: Full path of T4 text template file.
Parameters for template execution. These parameters can be accessed in text template using a parameter directive. The values passed in must be either serializable or extend type.
member.returns: Generated code if there were no processing errors. Throws otherwise.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.Templating.ScaffoldingAssemblyDirectiveProcessor
member.summary: This directive processor supports a T4 directive like this: {#@ ScaffoldingAssembly Processor="ScaffoldingAssemblyLoader" #} By using the above directive, a T4 template will be able to load the Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.dll and then can import any namespaces from there to execute code in them.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.Templating.TemplateInvoker
member.summary: Contains useful helper functions for running visual studio text transformation. For internal microsoft use only. Use in custom code generators.

member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNet.Scaffolding.Templating.TemplateInvoker.InvokeTemplate(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Executes a code generator template to generate the code.
member.param: Full path of the template file.
Parameters for the template. These parameters can be accessed in text template using a parameter directive. The values passed in must be either serializable or extend type.
member.returns: Generated code if there were no processing errors. Throws otherwise.
